statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -14 \\ -4 \\ -3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -40 \\ -12 \\ -4 \\ 24 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -14 \\ -4 \\ -3 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -40 \\ -12 \\ -4 \\ 24 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
